thread.title: Fire erupts at Times Square diner
thread.title_full: Fire erupts at Times Square diner

author: NICOLE HENSLEY
title: Fire erupts at Times Square diner
text:
Fire erupts at Times Square diner Fire erupts at Times Square diner The emergency lights from the restaurant fire can be seen from a nearby hotel. (Christie Barlow via Twitter)   5:53 AM 
A fire erupted at a Times Square diner early Tuesday. 
Firefighters rushed to the TSQ Brasserie at 7th Ave. and 49th St. just after 5 a.m. to tackle a three-alarm blaze that started in the duct work, FDNY officials said. 
Tourists staying at nearby hotels were woken up by sirens and reported smelling smoke. 
It's unclear if anyone was inside the restaurant when the fire broke out, the eatery normally closes at 1 a.m. The TSQ Brasserie is on the ground floor of the 12-story building at 723 7th Ave. (Google Maps Street View) 
The 12-story building in the Theater District was built in 1920. 
This is a developing story and will be updated.
